definitions: the process of making attitudes or behavior part of one's nature by learning or unconscious assimilation

examples.text: the internalization of an early traumatic experience
the willingness with which citizens pay taxes is one of the best indicators of the internalization of the social contract

shortDefinitions: process of making attitudes part of one's nature

definitions: the acquisition of knowledge of the rules of a language.
shortDefinitions: acquisition of knowledge of rules of language

definitions: the incorporation of costs as part of a pricing structure, especially social costs resulting from the manufacture and use of a product

examples.text: the “polluter pays” principle requires internalization of environmental costs

shortDefinitions: incorporation of costs in pricing structure

definitions: the process whereby a cell or organism takes in or absorbs something, in particular by endocytosis.
shortDefinitions: process of cell or organism taking in or absorbing something
